lead_paragraph: New Mexico State star forward Tyrone Nelson was indicted yesterday on felony charges stemming from allegations that he robbed a pizza deliveryman in August. Nelson faces a third-degree felony charge of robbery and a fourth-degree felony charge of conspiracy to commit robbery. Nelson, a 6-foot-9 junior, was a first-team all-W.A.C. selection last season when he was the Aggies’ leading scorer and rebounder. He has denied the allegations, and a university committee that looks into claims of student-athlete misconduct found there was no evidence Nelson was involved in the case.
